intro: Pseudocentrum hirtzii, commonly known as the hairy pseudocentrum, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes plants known for their milky sap and often showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species.
